frameset.note: Frames file for 'know' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'say' and 'think'

example.name: just transitive
example.text: I need to know the aircraft and flight number.

example.name: sentential thing known
example.text: The other side knows that Giuliani has always been prochoice.

example.name: with subject
example.text: He didn't know (anything) about most of the cases until Wednesday.

example.name: attributive
example.text: These nations are known as "little tigers"

example.name: infinitival thing known
example.text: I have never known a lady to faint in the belfry.
example.arg: a lady to faint in the belfry.

example.name: same thing, bogus parse
example.text: I have never known [a lady] [to faint in the belfry.]
example.note: The difference between this example and the previous is that there's no intervening S node between 'know' and the thing known, forcing the messy annotation.

example.name: marginal usage
example.text: Mary knows John for an idiot.

frameset.note: We'll assume the biblical sense of 'know' just won't come up in the WSJ but it'll take an Arg1, just in case.
